report_title: Conferencing Service Providers in the US
executive_summary: The COVID-19 pandemic resulted in an unprecedented rise in demand for the Conferencing Service Providers industry as social distancing measures resulted in the need to move all nonessential activities online. Most office work was moved online, and in-person events were postponed until they could be rescheduled online at the outset of the pandemic. As a result, businesses across the economy relied on conference services to continue operation.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Pandemic Drives Unprecedented Need for Conference Services
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: In 2020, the COVID-19 pandemic resulted in an unprecedented rise in demand for the conference services as social distancing measures resulted in the need to move all nonessential activities online. As a result, both workplaces and people moved their lives online, requiring an increase in demand from all segments of the market for conferencing services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: FOLLOWING LOCKDOWNS, ONLINE-BASED VIDEO APPLICATIONS BECOME THE NORM
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The uptick in demand for conferencing services has been sustained by both the continuation of the pandemic and broader economic growth, with conferencing services now part of the workplace norm. The use of conferencing services in business applications, coupled with the need to maintain a well-functioning work environment, has made web-based video platforms the primary beneficiary.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: THE SHIFT TO REMOTE WORK HAS SOLIDIFIED
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic-induced shift to remote work is expected to persist, fueling demand for the conferencing services. Prior to the pandemic, few employees worked from home, a trend that has been permanently altered. According to data from Gallup, a global analytics and polling firm, 13.0% of all full-time employees plan to work exclusively from home and 31.0% plan to work hybrid, working remotely part-time.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A SLOWDOWN IN NEW USERS WILL CURTAIL PROFIT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite the growth of the industry, a slowdown in new users will create challenges for existing operators. While remaining strong, revenue growth is expected to average less than one-quarter of its rate over the next five years relative to the current five-year period.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry provide conferencing services such as audio, video and web conferencing, primarily to businesses. Companies own and maintain conferencing equipment and provide these services through the internet. Additionally, companies maintain strategic partnerships with third-party web conferencing software providers, giving them the ability to offer these services to their customers.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - increasing

opportunities: Private investment in computers and software

key_trends: The COVID-19 pandemic resulted in an unprecedented rise in demand for the conference services. As a result, the industry has become a mainstay in the way business is done.
While conference services will remain a part of the everyday economy, leading companies like Zoom will struggle to boost margins. The post-pandemic slowdown in user growth is already here.
Intellectual property laws protect the products created by Conference service providers. Companies rely on patent, copyright, trademark and trade secret laws in the US.
Associations provide a range of services that aid operators. Assistance from associations covers areas like government relations, corporate education and intellectual property protection.
Web conferencing is the industry's primary service. Web conferencing is used as an umbrella term for various types of online conferencing and collaborative services.

Conference service providers rely on patent, copyright, trademark and trade secret laws. These laws permit companies to establish and maintain intellectual property rights to the products they create.
Profit margins have boomed as a result of the pandemic. The effects of COVID-19 have made conference services an indispensable part of the modern economy.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes include commercial banks, investment banks, insurance companies and credit card issuing companies. Companies in the financial services industry are responsible for protecting sensitive client information. These companies depend on conference service providers.

This segment includes discretionary and durable goods manufacturers, retailers, sporting goods and apparel companies, among others. Retailers and manufacturers depend on conference service providers to keep up point-of-sale systems, logistics and inventory management systems.

This segment includes users across the public sector, including federal, state and local governments. The federal government requires conference service providers in areas including defense systems, social security, benefits administration and Medicare.

This segment includes wired and wireless telecommunications carriers, software publishers, semiconductor and other electronic component manufacturers in addition to internet publishing and broadcasters. High-technology industries like consumer electronics manufacturers, aerospace and defense rely on conference service providers to facilitate research and development activities.

products_and_services.product_description: Web conferencing is used as an umbrella term for various types of online conferencing and collaborative services including webinars (web seminars), webcasts, and web meetings.

tier_1_suppliers: Computer & Packaged Software Wholesaling in the US
Internet Service Providers in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US
Communication Equipment Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Primary Care Doctors in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Web conferencing is the primary service provides by the industry, encompassing online meetings that involve two or more participants in different locations.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of both business establishments (around 30%) and population (around 25%).
The West region follows closely with around 25% of establishments and 20% of the population.
The Plains region has the lowest percentage of both establishments (around 5%) and population (around 7%).
The Rocky Mountains region also has a relatively low percentage of establishments (around 5%) and population (around 5%).

basis_points.basis_description: The advancement of technology, coupled with the need spurred by the pandemic, has encouraged the consolidation of the industry around the largest players. Zoom dominates the industry, accounting for more than a third of all industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: WAGES HINGE ON THE NEED FOR HIGHLY SKILLED WORKERS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages represent the industry's single-largest expense across the industry. Companies seek highly skilled computer and software engineers with terminal degrees, experienced consultants and other well-trained employees to remain competitive.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent additions to the industry is low. This is combined with a low concentration of innovation. Both factors being low suggests that new technology entry is slow and widespread, which limits the threat of disruptive threats hurting leading industry operators.

The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

volatility_points.volatility_title: RELIANCE ON IT BENEFITS THE INDUSTRY
volatility_points.volatility_description: The reliance on the IT consulting industry has moderated volatility despite the COVID-19 pandemic. Indeed, the pandemic only increased demand for industry services as nearly all office jobs moved remote, necessitating conferencing programs.
When corporate profit rises, businesses are more likely to spend on new computing infrastructure, including conferencing services.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: WEB CONFERENCING IS THE INDUSTRY'S PRIMARY SERVICE
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Web conferencing is used as an umbrella term for various types of online conferencing and collaborative services including webinars (web seminars), webcasts, and web meetings. Web conferencing is the primary service provides by the industry, encompassing online meetings that involve two or more participants in different locations.

FAQs.question: What is the document about?
FAQs.answer: The document contains industry data in the form of a table with columns for year, revenue, IVA (industry value added), number of establishments, enterprises, employment, exports, and domestic demand for a particular industry over the years 2005 to 2019.
